defs: an instrument for measuring temperatures, consisting of a graduated glass tube with a sealed, capillary bore in which mercury, coloured alcohol, etc. rises or falls as it expands or contracts from changes in temperature; a thermometer.
measurement of temperature; the act or process involved therein; thermometry.
= ಉಷ್ಣಮಾಪಕ.
an engine for changing heat into mechanical energy, such as a steam engine or gasoline engine; a heat-engine.
a pair of dissimilar conductors joined at two points to form a closed circuit so as to produce a thermoelectric current when the junctions are at different temperatures; a thermo-couple.
a ray in which heat passes by means of radiation.
the branch of chemistry that deals with the relationship of heat to chemical change; thermo-chemistry.
any of various diseases characterised by a high temperature.
= ಉಷ್ಣರಶ್ಮಿ.
that branch of metallurgy which deals with extraction of metals from minerals using high temperature; pyrometallurgy.
the area of the earth's surface between the Tropic of Cancer & the Tropic of Capricorn, divided by the equator, which normally has high atmospheric temperature; tropical zone; torrid zone.
transmission of heat through a conductor, the particles of the conductor not moving themselves; conduction.
the quality or an instance of transmitting heat through a conductor, by conduction method.
a kind of dyspepsia; indigestion.
that conducts heat through.
a substance or thing that conducts heat.
the quality or fact of conducting heat.
a decomposing into basic components or parts by heat; thermal decomposition.
any action at the end of which heat is given out; exothermic action.
the splitting of certain molecules into simpler by heat followed by recombination on cooling; thermal dissociation.
a kind of magical art.
an absorbing of heat.
heat treatment as annealing, hardening etc.
that quality or condition of a body which in degree varies directly with the amount of heat contained in the body; a particular degree of this; temperature.
the sun, whose rays of light are scorching.
not transferring the heat; not allowing heat to pass through or escape from; adiabatic.
not transparent to radiation of heat; impervious to radiant heat; adiathermic.
thin, easily digested porridge made by cooking rice flour in water or butter-milk; gruel.
(pros.) a meter having four lines of seven syllables each.
to become hot; to be heated.
anything wound round the head, as a covering; a head-gear.
an ornamental head-dress worn by a king as a symbol of sovereignty or the one the idols of gods are dressed with; a crown.
a protuberance on the top of the head of effigies of accomplished saints (corresponding to the ಸಹಸ್ರಪದ್ಮ of mysticism).
a long, narrow piece of cloth with which a head-gear is made.
a ray of light that is not hot; moonlight.
the moon.
hot water.
a hot water stream.
the warmest season of the year; summer.
a heavy and deep breath, with a hissing sound, (as from tiredness, deep disappointment etc.) 2. a sound made to scare animals.
a sound made to call a dog.

ಉಸ್ ಉಸ್ ಅನ್ನು us us annu = ಉಸ್ಸೆನ್ನು; ಉಸ್ಸೆನ್ನಿಸು ussennisu to make one undergo agony; to mete hardship to another; ಉಸ್ಸೆನ್ನು ussennu to sigh a deep breath as from tiredness, disappointment, etc. ಉಸ್ಸಪ್ಪ ussappa an utterance made from tiredness, disappointment, distress, etc.
a kind of dish made by boiling pulse or grains and seasoning with salt, chilli, mustard, oil etc.
= ಉಸಲಿ.
= ಉಸಲಿ.
concern, interest or involvement in an affair, business, etc.
a man who is not talking or uttering any word; a silent man.
= ಉಸಿಕನೆ - 1.
without uttering any word; silently; mutely.
without a reason or cause.
without working, functioning; idly; inactively.
to keep oneself quite, silent or mute; to restrain oneself from speaking.
the act or process of respiring; inhaling and exhaling air; breathing; respiration.
to breathe or carry on respiration; to inhale and exhale air; to respire.
to have a feeling of relief or reassurance.
that which is breathing; an animal.
= ಉಸಿರಾಡು.
3) to utter a sound, word; to speak.
= ಉಸಿರಾಡು.
to be expressed; to come out to be seen or perceived.
to breath rapidly and heavily as from running fast; to gasp; to pant.
to wish or convey in words that a disaster, evil shall happen to another; to curse; to imprecate.
to breathe or carry on respiration; to inhale and exhale air; to respire.
to talk; to speak.
to make a sound.
to give a pause in reading or singing to breathe.
air taken into the lungs and then let out, by living beings.
the vital air that carries on the function of a living being.
a stop or break in speaking or reading, to make the meaning more clear; (mus.) a holding of a tone or rest at the discretion of the performer; a pause.
(fig.) one's life motto.

ಉಸಿರಡಗು usiraḍagu one's voice to become silent; ಉಸಿರಾಡುವ ಹಾಗಾಗು usirāḍuva hāgāgu (a difficult situation) to become relaxed giving relief; ಉಸಿರಿಲ್ಲದಿರು usirilladiru to be dead; 2) to be unable to talk or reply; ಉಸಿರುಕಟ್ಟಿಸು usiru kaṭṭisu to prevent from breathing by blocking the windpipe or squeezing the throat of; to strangle; to suffocate; to choke; 2. to create an atmosphere, to build pressure on making another unable to talk or reply freely; ಉಸಿರುಕಟ್ಟು1 usiru kaṭṭu (breath) to get choked; to be blocked; 2. to be stifled and unable to think, talk freely; ಉಸಿರುಕಟ್ಟು2 usiru kaṭṭu loss of consciousness as a result of too little oxygen and too much carbon dioxide in the blood; asphyxia; ಉಸಿರುಕೊಡು usiru koḍu to help breathe; to give life to; to cause to regain life, become active again etc; ಉಸಿರುಡುಗು usiruḍugu (one's breathing) to stop for ever; 2. (one's vigour) to be lost; ಉಸಿರುತಟ್ಟು usiru taṭṭu (another's curse, ill-wish) to affect adversely; ಉಸಿರು ತಾಗು usiru tāgu = ಉಸಿರುತಟ್ಟು; ಉಸಿರುತೆಗೆದುಕೊ usiru tegeduko to draw air into the lungs; to breath in; to inhale; 2. to take a pause (by stopping what one is doing, as to take rest, to break monotony in reading or singing, etc.); ಉಸಿರುನಿಲ್ಲು usiru nillu (the breath) to stop for ever; ಉಸಿರು ಬಿಗಿಹಿಡಿದಿರು usiru bigi hiḍidiru (fig.) to hold breath from fear, excitement, etc.; to bate one's breath; ಉಸಿರುಬಿಡು usirubiḍu to breath out; to push out the air from the lungs; to exhale; 2. to utter a word; to speak; to talk; ಉಸಿರು ಸಿಕ್ಕಿ ಹಾಕಿಕೊ usiru sikki hākiko (breathing) to have a sudden stoppage (or have difficulty in normal functioning) due to a sudden shock, fright etc.; ಉಸಿರುಹಿಡಿ usiru hiḍi to hold one's life; to continue to live (under difficult situation); 2. to hold one's breath; to take time to breath; to take rest; ಉಸಿರುಹಿಡಿತ usiru hiḍita = ಉಸಿರುಕಟ್ಟು - 2; ಉಸಿರೆತ್ತು usirettu to talk; to speak out; to utter a word; ಒಂದೇ ಉಸಿರಿಗೆ (ಉಸಿರಿನಲ್ಲಿ) onde usirige (usiinalli) (continue what one one is doing - as, speaking, reciting, hurrying up, etc.) without a pause; ಹೋದ ಉಸಿರು ಬರು hōda usiru baru (fig.) (relief as from pain, agony, etc., comfort) to be restored.
in the respiratory tract of most land vertebrates, the tube extending from the larynx to the two bronchi; the windpipe; the trachea.
a pipe of a considerable length, carried by divers for getting air to breath underwater; a wind pipe.
either of the two spongelike respiratory organs in the thorax of vertebrates, that oxygenate the blood and remove carbon dioxide from it; the lung.
a bag for carrying oxygen (esp. while going under water or climbing a mountain).
an airtight bag, filled with air or any light gas, that rises in the air or floats on water; an air bag; a balloon.
a difficult breathing caused by an allergy or disease.
a person lacking positive qualities, such as of warmth, vitality, interest, brightness, brilliance, etc.; an obsolutely useless person.
= ಉಸಿರಾಡು.
ಕೊನೆ ಉಸಿರೆಳೆ kone usireḷe (fig.) to breathe one's last; to die.
= ಉಸಿರಾಡು.
a feeling of ill-will towards another for harm, damage or evil caused.
to speak, advise in vain.
a particular point in a passage, poem, etc. where a very short pause is taken.
= ಉಸಿರುತೆಗೆದುಕೊ (see under ಉಸಿರು2).
the body of a living being, as a home for the breath.
Sarasvati, the Goddess of speech.
Brahma, the consort of Goddess Sarasvati.
= ಉಸಿರಾಡು.
(the breath) to be inhaled and exhaled rapidly (as from tiredness, fear, anxiety etc.).
loose, gritty particles of worn or disintegrated rock, varying in size from about 0.1 mm to 2 mm in diameter, usually deposited along the shores of bodies of water, in river beds or in deserts; sand.
= ಉಸುಕು.
= ಉಸುಕು.

ಉಸುಬಿನ ನೊಣ usubina noṇa sand fly - a) any of various other biting dipterous flies of the family of Psychodidae, that may transmit various diseases, as leishmaniasis; b) any of the family of Ceratopogonidae, of midges with piercing and sucking mouthparts: some species attack humans and animals; ಉಸುಬಿನನೊಣದ ಜ್ವರ usibina noṇada jvara any of the various diseases, as leishmaniasis, transmitted by sand flies; sand fly-fever.

ಉಳಿದ uḷida remaining; balance; rest; other; ಉಳಿದುಕೊ uḷiduko to stay at a place (for sometime); to sojourn; ಉಳಿದುದು ಬಳಿದುದು uḷidudu baḷidudu (derog.) that which is remaining; that which is taken out from the cooking vessel by scratching; ಉಳಿದು ಬಿಸುಡು uḷidu bisuḍu to abandon completely or without regard; ಉಳಿಯಗೊಡು uḷiyagoḍu to allow to remain; to allow to be alive; ಉಳಿಯದಿರು uḷiyadiru not to stay back or remain; 2. to be available as remainder; to be exhausted completely; ನಂಟೂ ಉಳಿಯಬೇಕು, ಗಂಟೂ ಉಳಿಯಬೇಕು naṇṭū uḷiybēku, gaṇṭū uḷiybēku (prov.) to have advantages of both the alternatives; to have the cake and eat it too.

ಊಟ ಉಡುಗೆ ūṭa uḍuge the essentials as food and clothes; ಊಟದ ಅಂಗಡಿ ūṭada aŋgaḍi a commercial establishment that provides food at a cost; a hotel; ಊಟದ ತಾಟು ūṭada tāṭu a metal dining plate; ಊಟ ಉಪಚಾರ ūṭa upcāra (often wrongly used as ಊಟೋಪಚಾರ) food served and hospitality extended (to one's guests); ಊಟಮಾಡು ūṭa māḍu to eat one's meal; ಊಟಕ್ಕಿಲ್ಲದ ಉಪ್ಪಿನಕಾಯಿ ಯಾತಕ್ಕೂ ಬೇಡ ūṭakkillada uppinakāyi yātakkū bēḍa (prov.) a thing not got when it is need, is useless; a book that is shut is but a block; ಅಗ್ರಸಾಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಊಟ ಚಂದ್ರಸಾಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ನಿದ್ರೆ agrasāleyalli ūṭa candrasāleyalli nidre (prov.) lead a irresponsible life (caring not for even one's family); ಊಟ ಬಲ್ಲವನಿಗೆ ರೋಗವಿಲ್ಲ ūṭaballavanige rōgavilla (prov.) eat and drink measuredly and defy the medicine; ಊಟ ತನ್ನಿಚ್ಛೆ ನೋಟ ಪರರಿಚ್ಛೆ ūṭa tannicche, nōṭa pararicche (prov.) each one has his own taste of food, which cannot be generalised; ಊಟಕ್ಕಿಲ್ಲದವ ಕಾಟ ಕೊಡುತ್ತಾನೆ ūṭakkilladava kāṭa koḍuttāne (prov.) snatch a poor man's bread to turn him antisocial; ಮಾತಿಗೆ ಮೊದಲು ಗಾದೆ, ಊಟಕ್ಕೆ ಮೊದಲು ಉಪ್ಪಿನಕಾಯಿ mātige modalu gāde, ūṭakke modalu uppinakāyi (prov.) a proverb is as essential for a meaningful and effective communication, as the pickles are for a good meal; ಊಟ ಕೌರವರಲ್ಲಿ, ಪಕ್ಷ ಪಾಂಡವರಲ್ಲಿ ūṭa Kauravaralli, pakṣa Paṇḍavaralli (prov.) get the benefits from one, but support his rival.
